article.mainText: Cash-strapped Senate Democrats just got some good news: A $1 million donation from Sen. Patty Murray. The Washington senator and No. 4 Democratic leader made the transfer from her flush campaign account to the Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee, announced by leaders in a party lunch. The infusion follows $3 million in transfers from Sen. Chuck Schumer, who is poised to ascend to the Democratic leader spot next year. Story Continued Below Murray, a former two-time Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee chair, is poised to move up in leadership next year, though she has yet to announce what role she will pursue. And her donation could help in the tight battle for Senate control: Party honchos are practically begging for enough money to run robust TV campaigns in a handful of battleground states.
article.title: Patty Murray gives $1 million to DSCC
